Headline: New Delhi chokes under blanket of smog
News Content: New Delhi residents on Saturday (November 20) woke up to another day of heavy smog caused by pollution and stubble-burning in fields outside of the Indian capital. One of the world’s most polluted captials, the city of 20 million battles chronic winter smog each year as falling temperatures trap deadly pollutants in the air. “The children are unable to go to the schools…the schools had just opened and then they were shut immediately. We are facing a lot of problems as well,” said New Delhi resident Prabhat Kumar Prajapati. In some parts of the Indian capital, “smog towers” have been erected to improve air quality. Powered by 40 fans and 5,000 filters, the structure helps mitigate air pollution by removing 80% of PM2.5 and PM10 particultate matter of the air it sucks in, authorities say.
